greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (1 - eta(q)^5 / eta(q^5)) / 5 in powers of q.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000

G. N. Watson, Ramanujans Vermutung über Zerfällungsanzahlen, J. Reine Angew. Math. (Crelle), 179 (1938), 97-128. This is the expression B^5/C in the notation of p. 106. [Added by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 13 2009]
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ n < 1, 0, Sum[ d KroneckerSymbol[ 5, d], {d, Divisors@n}]]; (* _Michael Somos_, Apr 26 2015 *)
a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ (1 - QPochhammer[ q]^5 / QPochhammer[ q^5]) / 5, {q, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Apr 26 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<1, 0, A = x * O(x^n); -1/5 * polcoeff( eta(x + A)^5 / eta(x^5 + A), n))};
(PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, 0, sumdiv(n, d, d * kronecker(5, d)))} /* _Michael Somos_, Mar 21 2008 */
(1..n).each{|i| s += i if n % i == 0 && i % k == m}
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jun 18 2005
